basics.name: Chiara Duyn
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: Hi! My name is Chiara Duyn. I am currently pursuing a Bachelor of Arts in Computer Science within the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii at Manoa. I am anticipated to graduate in the fall of 2025.

work.summary: Develop and implement IT security improvement efforts using various tools to improve efficiency and reduce risk.
highlights: Understand functionality of implemented systems to maximize utilization.
Work with Functional Business Analysts to review, assess and test new security functionality.
Assist in organizing/coordinating demonstrations, training, testing, implementation and communication of all approved system changes and the business process.
Assist in creating ad-hoc reports using the reporting/BI tools and leverage the reports to measure/analyse key performance metrics.
Partner with internal resources to assist in change management initiatives

volunteer.position: Treasurer of the YLB (Youth Leadership Board)
highlights: Attend and participate in board meetings
Calculate and document spendings for the organizations records
Plan and exceute events within budget

awards.title: KELA Achievement Grant
awards.summary: Awarded to students enrolled in at least 6 Kapi‘olani CC credits, be a classified student with Kapi‘olani CC as their home campus, and have earned an A or B in two Math and Sciences Department courses.

awards.title: Deans List
awards.summary: Recognizes students who earn a 3.5 or higher grade point ratio with 15 or more accumulated credits over Fall, Spring, and/or Summer semester(s)

awards.title: Published Author
awards.summary: My scientific poster titled Formula Fish was selected to be published the 2024 Pueo o Kū Journal of Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics (STEM).
